alimentation . manger local.description:
Local food allows us to reduce the transport distances of the products
we consume. However, even if it may seem counter-intuitive, local food
can, depending on the case, be unfavorable in terms of greenhouse gas
emissions: the impact of the origin of our products cannot be summed up
in a comparison between short and long distance. The effects of scale,
the centralization of products, the efficiency of the transport used (or
conversely the lack of efficiency) make the matter more complex from a
carbon accounting point of view.

Nevertheless, local food has many other positive impacts, first of all
by supporting the farmers of our regions!

It is important to keep in mind that this is a first approach that will
be refined later on. As an example, we can suppose that the impact of
this action will be more important for vegetalized diets, which is not
taken into account here.

alimentation . manger de saison.description:
Contrary to what one might imagine, the impact of this action is
relatively low because the share of seasonal products is very low in the
average French person's diet.

But there are many other benefits to seasonal food such as the lower
consumption of water, the diversity of crops, or the lower dependence on
hydrocarbons (gas and oil) that heat the greenhouses.

It is important to keep in mind that this is a first approach that will
be refined later on. As an example, we can suppose that the impact of
this action will be more important for vegetated systems, which is not
taken into account here.

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.description:
Bottled water has an environmental impact 450 times greater than tap water. It costs between 100 and 300 times more (80% of the price comes from the
production of the packaging) and is a major contributor to plastic pollution of the oceans.

> Our plastic waste is often sold to other countries. In 2016, no less than 50% of sorted European plastic waste was exported to China.

d√©passe: alimentation . d√©chets . avoir un stop pub

alimentation . d√©chets . devenir z√©ro.description: Becoming 'zero waste' is particularly challenging: tracking down the smallest item of packaging requires constant attention. > You should be aware that in the case of a 'zero waste' commitment, we are still considering emissions of greenhouse gases (albeit considerably reduced), as it is very difficult, if not impossible, to generate no waste at all, some of which is invisible and unavoidable it is very difficult, if not impossible, to generate zero waste, some of which is invisible and unavoidable. To find out more about zero waste lifestyles, visit the Zero Waste Franceswebsite

alimentation . d√©chets . r√©duire gaspi.description:
In France, the average food waste is estimated at 30 kg per person per
year, including 7 kg of food still wrapped!

If we take a step back and consider the entire value chain (i.e. from
the field to the plate) it is about 10 million tons of food that are
wasted per year, or 150 kg per capita.

Reducing food waste is therefore essential in order to avoid producing
to throw away!

You will find useful tips and practices
[here](https://agirpourlatransition.ademe.fr/particuliers/conso/alimentation/pourquoi-gaspillons-autant-nourriture)

alimentation . d√©chets . composter.description:
Our bio-waste, i.e. the putrescible waste from our food (peelings,
leftovers, etc.), represents a large part of the weight of our grey
garbage can, thus contributing to increase the carbon footprint
associated with waste management. This waste is very often little or
poorly recycled despite the environmental benefit it can bring: compost,
a rich organic substance that is beneficial to the soil. Composting our
biowaste (individually or collectively) allows us to reduce the size of
our garbage cans and to encourage the creation of compost that can
eventually be used as an alternative to chemical fertilizers.

alimentation . d√©chets . avoir un stop.description:
This is a sticker you place on your letterbox to inform advertising distributors that you refuse to receive catalogues, promotions, restaurant menus and all kinds of advertising.

This does not prevent all advertising, but it sends out a strong signal and generally considerably reduces the amount of paper waste received.

divers . partage NGC.description:
In addition to the actions you can take, talking about this simulator to your friends, your colleagues, sharing it on social networks, etc. is also a strong way to contribute to the reduction of CO‚ÇÇ emissions!

It's certainly a very small digital impact in addition (well less than 1kgCO‚ÇÇe, well unless you're a big network star ü§© !), but it's especially potentially a lot of impact in terms of change! üìâ
If these people decide on the same actions as you, imagine the multiplier effect! üôå

divers . aider les autres.description:
There comes a time when gaining weight becomes very complicated

If your footprint falls below 4 tons, or if certain constraints make your progress impossible, you're probably better off helping others reduce their footprint than torturing yourself over yours

How can you do this? By distributing this simulator, by discussing these topics with your friends and family, by leading workshops in your company or association, or even by helping someone to change one of their polluting habits.

divers . publicit√©.description:
Through the desires they create in us, advertising and marketing incite us to overconsumption and early renewal of our equipment. These promotions serve to maximize the renewal rate and the volume of goods sold, volumes that are often disproportionate to the real demand. Not renewing our appliances and equipment too early and making them last as long as possible is a strong gesture for the climate. > For example: > Not renewing your smartphone too early (after 2 years) saves 16 kgCO2eq > For a television (4 years) it is 170 kgCO2eq avoided If urban advertising (bus stops, giant billboards, supermarkets) is complicated to ignore, note that it is easy to get rid of it **on the Web** with an extension to install in 1 click in your browser. **On mobile**, it depends on your device:
On iPhoneTheiOS ecosystem is padlocked by Apple, so there's not much you can do.
On AndroidYoucan use Firefox and install the muBlock extension, or another browser from the app store that allows blocking (Chrome does not). For applications, it is more complicated, but it is possible to install alternative applications without ads (for example Youtube Vanced or New Pipe as a replacement for the Youtube application) or to install a blocker for all applications (for example Blokada).

Renewing equipment prematurely, on the other hand, contributes to producing more equipment for the same service.

Housing and in particular its heating (oil or gas) has a significant
impact on the climate.

Lowering the temperature by one or two degrees can be a way to reduce
its footprint.

Source : ADEME - [40 tips and tricks to save water and
energy](https://www.ademe.fr/40-trucs-astuces-economiser-leau-lenergie)

logement . baisse temp√©rature . nombre.description:
¬æ of a household's energy consumption is spent on heating and hot water.

This energy consumption, in addition to having a significant financial
cost, increases the carbon footprint of households.

However, it can easily be limited by lowering the temperature of the
occupied rooms without losing thermal comfort or feeling cold (provided
that the dwellings are well insulated).

For example, set the temperature between 19¬∞ and 21¬∞C in occupied rooms
during the day (and 17¬∞C at night or in rooms that are not very busy).

Indeed, lowering the heating temperature by 1¬∞C represents an energy

logement . √©teindre appareils.description:
Our apartments and homes are full of digital devices and appliances,
which often remain on or on standby.

The use of simple power strips makes it possible to turn them off
completely in the blink of an eye.

The standby have made progress and individually consume less than in the
past: a European directive applicable since January 2017 limits their
power. It is 0.5 W for a number of categories of devices, but 3 W for
devices that remain connected to the Internet or data networks.

Source: ADEME - [Reducing your electricity
bill](https://www.ademe.fr/sites/default/files/assets/documents/guide-pratique-reduire-facture-electricite.pdf),
page 18.

logement . remplacer gaz par PAC.titre: Switching from a gas boiler to a heat pump
logement . remplacer gaz par PAC.description:
Gas-fired boilers are among the most CO‚ÇÇ emitting. Replacing them with
lower-carbon alternatives like heat pumps is a strong move to reduce
your carbon footprint.

> Heat pumps are often referred to as *PACs*.

üí° Their principle is ingenious: it's a reverse fridge! Your fridge,
thanks to a little electricity, cools its interior and rejects the heat
into the room. The heat pump cools the outside air to heat your home.

> Bonus: if it's too hot in your home in the summer, some heat pumps can
> reverse their operation and act as air conditioning in the summer.

logement . remplacer chauffage √©lectriq.titre: Switching from electric heating to a heat pump
logement . remplacer chauffage √©lectriq.description:
Gas boilers are among the biggest emitters of CO‚ÇÇ. Replacing them with lower-carbon alternatives such as heat pumps is a strong move towards reducing your carbon footprint.

> Heat pumps are often referred to as *PAC*.

üí° Their principle is ingenious: it's a fridge in reverse! Using a little electricity, your fridge cools its interior and releases the heat into the room. The heat pump cools the outside air to heat your home.

> Bonus: if it's too hot in your home in summer, some heat pumps can reverse their operation and act as air conditioning in summer.

logement . climatisation . r√©duction.titre: Getting rid of my air conditioning
logement . climatisation . r√©duction.description:
Doing without air conditioning is not easy everywhere. But it is absolutely essential that recourse to this cooling system 
as a last resort, after more sustainable and less carbon-intensive solutions have been implemented.

First of all, and the same applies to heating, the home must be well insulated. Heating or air-conditioning an uninsulated home 
is literally throwing energy (and money) down the drain.

Secondly, you need to choose thermal comfort solutions that consume less energy and do not leak refrigerants, 
such as fans (including ceiling fans, which are widely used in hot countries), solar shading of light inlets (blinds, shutters, etc.), etc 
(blinds, shutters, sails), and very good ventilation at the coolest times of the day (well, night).

logement . r√©novation √©nerg√©tique.description: Energy renovation, despite its cost, allows, in the long term, very strong energy savings and thus contributes to reducing the carbon footprint of your home These savings will be even more important if you live in a poorly insulated home. To find out which renovations are best suited to your home as well as the assistance available: DOING.

These homes will no longer be available for rent in 2028. To find out which renovations are best suited to your home, and what grants are available, go to: FAIRE.

logement . mutualiser son logement.description:
Sharing a flat is not only good for your finances and social ties,
it's also a way of reducing your impact on the climate by sharing space, consumption and equipment.

Over the last few decades, the surface area of housing per inhabitant has only increased, rising from 30 m¬≤ in the 1980s to over 40 m¬≤ today! 
This is a major contributor to land artificialisation and the emission of large quantities of greenhouse gases linked to the construction of new homes.

Sharing existing buildings more equitably is therefore an issue with significant potential for reducing the carbon footprint.

services soci√©taux . voter.description:
Every year or so, we each have the opportunity to vote for representatives to represent our ideas.

Presidential, legislative, departmental and regional elections are the opportunity to bring the subject of the climate, and therefore the footprint of public services, and all the efforts that are complicated to do alone.

But that's not all! If you're a student, maybe there are votes to guide the work of the school or associations? If you are an employee, can you influence the trips offered by the works council? If you are retired, can you give your voice in the board of directors of your insurances, of the banks which have your money?

services soci√©taux . pression locale.description:

The first step is to investigate, then simply discuss this with friends and officials in a position to act.

Minimum distance to trigger this action. 

> If someone tells us that he only drives 500km in a year, there is little chance that he will drive to work 
> If someone says he only drives 500km in a year, there is little chance that he will drive to work.

We define the threshold distance as 2km (one way trip), for 5 days a week.

transport . boulot . distance . km aller.description:
We are talking about the distance *going*, with the mode of transportation you prefer.

70% of the workers in France work less than 15km from their home.

57% work within 10km and 78% within 20km

Source: INSEE 2004 and 2013 studies, stable figures.

transport . boulot . covoiturage . nombr.question: How many people could carpool with you?

transport . boulot . sans voiture.titre: Go to work without a car
transport . boulot . sans voiture.description:
When possible, taking public transport or light vehicles (walking,
cycling, personal moped, ...) to work reduces our climate footprint,
but also improves our quality of life.

[70%](https://www.ecologie-solidaire.gouv.fr/covoiturage-en-france-avantages-et-reglementationen-vigueur)
of home-work trips are made with individual vehicles, most of them alone
in their cars. This is what we call auto-solism.

In addition to emitting a lot of greenhouse gases, this auto-soloing is
detrimental to the quality of the air in our cities and therefore to our
health, and it clogs up urban roads.

> As an example traffic jams represent in Ile-de-France per year and per
> person [163 hours
> lost](https://www.tomtom.com/en_gb/traffic-index/paris-traffic) or
> about 6 days.

> üí° Did you know? The State and many regions or cities subsidize
> mechanical, electric, cargo, folding bikes, etc. [Calculate your aid
> üö≤Ô∏è in 3 clicks](https://mesaidesvelo.fr).

transport . boulot . t√©l√©travail.description:
Teleworking means you don't have to travel to work every day.

It is obviously not possible for many employees, but the health crisis of 2020 has shown that many professions can indeed be teleworked.

In this calculation, we only take into account teleworking days that avoid a journey by private car, not the rebound effects.

transport . boulot . faire du covoiturag.description: While long-distance car-sharing is well known in France, short-distance car-sharing is almost non-existent: today, only 3% of home-to-work journeys are made by car-sharing. Since 2020, you can ask your employer for the sustainable mobility package, so that your carpooling is paid for up to ‚Ç¨400/year, exempt from tax and social security contributions! In all cases, remember to adapt your mode of transport to the distance and give preference to soft modes or public transport (bus, metro, bike, walking, etc.) as much as possible. Use the My Transport Impact calculator to see and compare the impact of different modes of transport.

transport . scooter √©lectrique.description: The e-moped isn't a miracle solution, but for certain uses it can prove (very) useful in reducing our footprint. However, we must be careful not to reach the simplistic conclusion that switching to an electric vehicle fleet would be enough to decarbonize our travels. Whenever possible (55% of our journeys in France are less than 5km), the priority should be to promote active mobility (such as cycling) and public transport. Nevertheless, the figure we've given does correspond to the difference in greenhouse gas emissions that would have occurred if you had travelled your km with with an electric vehicle rather than a combustion engine. It's also important to bear in mind that the idea here is not to encourage you to buy a new electric moped, but rather to make your equipment last, and give preference to second-hand vehicles!

transport . arr√™ter ferry.description:
The ferry's carbon footprint is smaller than that of the plane, but still significant. A good idea would be to use it only as an alternative to flying, for your sea crossings.
If you're used to going on cruises, perhaps you could think about replacing this mode of holiday with another that emits fewer greenhouse gases.

transport . r√©duire ferry.description:
The ferry's carbon footprint is smaller than that of the plane, but still significant. A good idea would be to use it only as an alternative to flying, for your sea crossings.
If you're used to going on cruises, perhaps you could think about replacing this mode of holiday with another that emits fewer greenhouse gases.

transport . √©co-conduite.description:
Eco-driving is a simple and effective action that everyone can take.  

It saves an average of 15% on fuel, reduces vehicle maintenance costs, 
reduce the risk of accidents by an average of 10-15%, and make substantial savings that can amount to several hundred euros 
several hundred euros. 

The application of eco-driving is all the more relevant in towns and urban areas where there are frequent stops and restarts 
restarting are frequent.

transport . limitation autoroute.description: The Citizens' Climate Convention has proposed a reduction of the speed limit on highways from 130km/h to 110km/h in 2020 The proposal is detailed here Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the International Energy Agency made this its 1st recommendation to reduce our purchases of Russian oil. Here we offer an assessment of this measure based on your specific situation.

transport . limitation autoroute . r√©du.description: ![](https://imgur.com/NB9CUUt.jpg) From this graph, by graphical deduction (we have not yet gone back to the study data, page 151 figure 26), we find the data below. Diesel: 6.5 l/100 at 130km/h -> 4.75 at 110km/h Gasoline: 11.75 l/100 at 130km/h -> 8.65 at 110km/h So -27% in diesel and -26% in petrol by going from 130 to 110. We keep the order of magnitude of 25%.

transport . limitation autoroute . km au.question: Approximately how many motorway kilometres do you drive each year?
transport . limitation autoroute . km au.description: We travel around 80 billion km / year on motorways (cars).

transport . covoiturage.description: This action concerns all his car trips. While long-distance carpooling is well known in France, short-distance carpooling is almost non-existent: today only 3% of home-work trips are made by carpooling. In any case, remember to adapt your mode of transportation to the distance and to favor soft modes or public transportation (bus, subway, bicycle, walking, etc.) as much as possible. The My Transport Impact calculator allows you to visualize and compare the impact of different modes of transport.

transport . autopartage.description:
We assume that a person who travels a lot of kilometres by car each year will find it difficult to get involved in a car-sharing scheme. It will be much more obvious for someone who does little driving.

The impact of car-sharing on reducing the use of private cars is well established. 
Car-sharing leads to a twofold reduction: a drop in the number of kilometres travelled (by an average of 41%), and a drop in the number of cars used by households. On average, it is estimated that one car-sharing vehicle can replace up to 9 private cars.

transport . voiture 5km.titre: Do without a car for less than 5 km
transport . voiture 5km.description: In France, 4 out of 10 car journeys are less than 3 km long and no less than 177 million journeys of less than 5 km are made alone by car each week (excluding home-to-work journeys) All of these "short" trips taken together account for nearly 10% of the total distance traveled by car each year in France Thus, turning to active mobility (bicycle, moped, etc.) for these "short" trips can significantly reduce our GHG emissions emissions while relieving congestion on urban roads and improving air quality in our polluted cities. > Did you know? The state and many regions or cities subsidize mechanical, electric, cargo, folding bikes, etc. Calculate your subsidy üö≤Ô∏è in 3 clicks.

transport . voiture 5km . usage r√©duit.valeur: (transport . voiture . km - distance totale) * transport . voiture . empreinte au kilom√®tre

variations.si: distance totale renseign√©e > transport . voiture . km

transport . voiture 5km . fr√©quence.question: How many times a week do you drive less than 5km?
transport . voiture 5km . fr√©quence.description:
I go to get my bread 2km away by car, that's one trip. I go to work
every day from Monday to Friday at 4km, that's 5 trips.

transport . voiture √©lectrique.description: The electric car is not a miracle solution, but for certain uses it can prove (very) useful in reducing our carbon footprint. However, we must be careful not to come to the simplistic conclusion that all we need to do is switch to an electric car fleet to reduce the carbon footprint of French travel. Whenever possible (55% of our journeys are less than 5km), the priority should be to encourage active mobility (such as cycling) and public transport. However, the figure we have given you does correspond to the difference in greenhouse gas emissions that would have occurred if you had travelled the same distance with with an electric vehicle rather than a combustion engine. Of course, a second-hand electric car costs less. It also enables you to obtain purchase aid. The battery range may have decreased slightly, but remember that the vast majority of our journeys are less than 50 km!

transport . r√©duire taille.description:
The size of the car has a major influence on the carbon footprint of your journeys: bigger cars not only have a larger construction footprint, they also consume more energy to get around.
All too often these days, we choose our vehicle based on what we 'could' do with it.
A good ecological calculation would be to choose a car that's suitable for everyday use, and if necessary hire a bigger vehicle when the need arises (moving heavy objects, going on holiday together...).

transport . faire durer.description:
It's very difficult to put a figure on a vehicle's lifespan, either in terms of kilometres driven or in years. 
The fact is that it depends on many parameters: vehicle maintenance, accidents, driving style, engine type, dependence on electronics, etc.
Some vehicles are ready for the scrap heap after 150,000 km, while others are still going strong after 400,000 km. 

Yet a large part of a vehicle's footprint lies in its construction. Making it last is therefore essential and has a major impact on the carbon footprint.

We have calculated that a well-maintained vehicle can increase its lifespan by 30%.

alimentation.description:
What we eat, and to a lesser extent what we drink, largely influences
our climate footprint.

The first factor is the quantity of meat and dairy products: - the
production of a kilo of meat emits CO‚ÇÇ, but also other gases (such as
methane) which warm up the climate much more quickly - we have to feed
the animals with cereal products that we could have eaten ourselves,
often resulting from deforestation.

Contrary to what we often hear, the distance our food travels, the
seasonality of fruits and vegetables, and the amount of plastic
packaging are in the background.

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.question: Do you drink bottled water?
alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.description:
If you mainly drink tap water, and your consumption of bottled water is limited to rare occasions (for example, one bakery meal a week, with their famous "sandwich + dessert + bottled plastic drink" menu), answer no. We'll be happy to help you.

If you regularly buy packs of bottled water at the supermarket, or buy a small bottle every day at the canteen at work, answer yes.

> You should know that drinking tap water has such a small climate footprint that we won't ask you about your water consumption.
It is assumed that each person drinks 1.5 liters of water per day.

alimentation . boisson . alcool.description:
Surprisingly, our alcohol consumption plays a significant role in our
footprint.

The good news is that we can improve it in very simple ways: more than
food, a drink is heavy, travels a lot, and its packaging has a
significant footprint.

> Let's take the example of a üç∫ 25cl beer: brewed at the end of the
> world, it has traveled thousands of miles and its contents (the drink)
> are packaged in a container that weighs almost the same (200g of
> glass).

> By favoring a locally brewed beer, served on draft (the keg being
> reused for years), we can drastically reduce the footprint without
> changing the consumption.

alimentation . petit d√©jeuner . type.description:
There's an infinite variety of breakfasts. We've selected a few to give you an easy answer.

Even if you can't find your exact breakfast, choose the one that comes closest!

> Please note that your consumption of fruit juice / coffee / tea / hot chocolate is counted in the question dedicated to hot drinks.

alimentation . petit d√©jeuner . type ..description:
We have chosen to consider a standard French breakfast close to the
["continental"](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/D√©jeuner#Repas_de_type_continental)
breakfast. It includes bread, butter, jam, pastries and a fruit.

A bowl of milk or yogurt with cereal. The origin (animal or vegetable)
of the milk you drink will be asked later!
A savory breakfast: toast, eggs, cold cuts. We've lightened the traditional English or Irish breakfast, which also includes baked beans, sausages, tomatoes, mushrooms and potatoes.

You don't eat anything for breakfast (but you can drink coffee, tea or
hot chocolate which is counted in another question).

alimentation . local . consommation.question: Do you consume local products?
alimentation . local . consommation.description:
This question allows us to adjust the footprint of your diet according to your habits about the local nature of your purchases.

We consider "local" to be food that comes from the region where you live or from nearby regions.

This criterion has a relatively low impact, because the share of transport in the carbon footprint of the products we consume is lower than the emissions linked to production, processing or packaging, especially when your diet is meat-based.

But it's still a win-win situation, and the benefits of eating locally don't stop at the climate footprint.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Be careful, if you do your shopping by car several kilometres from home each week, it's possible that the last kilometre's footprint will exceed the gains from eating locally!

alimentation . local . niveau.description: A coefficient of 0.333 and 0.666 is applied if the user indicates that he/she consumes local "sometimes" or "often" respectively.

alimentation . local . part locale.description:
In a first approach, we chose to work on the menus proposed in the
simulator by considering the emission factors of Agribalyse, updated by
dividing the share of transport by 2.

variations.sinon: facteur de saison * part de saison

alimentation . de saison . consommation.question: Do you eat seasonal products?
alimentation . de saison . consommation.description: This question enables us to correct the imprint of your diet on the seasonal nature of your purchases. This impact is relatively low, as the proportion of seasonal products represents only 7% of the average French person's diet. But that's still something, and the benefits of seasonal consumption don't stop at the climate footprint. > But when is an apple or cauliflower in season? > Discover our mini-site Mes fruits et l√©gumes de saison.

alimentation . de saison . niveau.description: A coefficient of 0.333 and 0.666 is applied if the user indicates that he or she consumes seasonal produce "sometimes" or "often" respectively.

alimentation . de saison . part de saiso.description:
The percentage of seasonal products is applied to an individual's total
meals.

bilan.description: Here is an estimate of your climate footprint for the year. It evolves according to your answers. It is your share of greenhouse gas emissions, and therefore of global warming. All the footprints of companies are included. For example, if you drive a car üöó 10 km, the emissions are not attributed to the country that extracted this oil from the ground, nor to the company that refined it and distributed it in gas stations, but to the final consumer in his car. If we add up this footprint for each French person and each other üåç earthling, we get the total impact of human activities on the climate. *Please note: this simulator gives the order of magnitude of your footprint and that of the French: the estimate is not to be taken to the nearest tenth.* But what does it mean, this ten tons of CO‚ÇÇ equivalent? Why is it important? **We tell you all about the climate footprint** and how to locate this footprint (low, high?) ‚û° in this article.

divers . ameublement . meubles.question: What furniture do you own that is less than 10 years old?
divers . ameublement . meubles.description:
Enter here the furnishings that make up the interior of your home, less than 10 years old; and only products purchased new, 
we exclude second-hand and warehouse sales.

Don't forget your kitchen furniture!  

We consider that all furniture is used by the whole household, even if some of it may only be used individually (beds, for example), which is a limitation of the test.

Don't hesitate to use the categories small furniture (weighing less than 10 kg, such as a small sideboard or coffee table) or large furniture (weighing more than 10 kg) 
or large furniture (over 10 kg, such as a large desk) if you can't categorize what you've got in the rest of the suggestions.

divers . ameublement . pr√©servation.question: What effort do you make to keep your furniture as long as possible?
divers . ameublement . pr√©servation.description:
To avoid asking you to provide the exact age of all the furnishings you own, we have defined an average age for each item (generally 10 years).

> We are not trying to evaluate the age of the furniture before it becomes unusable, but the age when the owners decide to replace it with new furniture.
It is up to you to place yourself in relation to the average.

divers . animaux domestiques.description: We speak here about domestic animals, whose population increase (about 10 millions of cats in France in 2000 against 15 million currently (2020)) is linked to human beings (unlike wild animals, whose History seems to show a stable GES balance). According to the FACCO annual report (Chambre Syndicale des Fabricants d'Aliments pour Chiens, Chats, Oiseaux et autres animaux familiiers) 2022 43.5% of French households own at least one cat or dog. Nearly 1 out of 3 French households owns a cat and 1 out of 5 owns a dog. It is therefore clear that we cannot ignore the footprint of our pets and these emissions are, by definition, of anthropogenic origin. The domestic life of our animals leads to additional emissions to be attributed to a human individual (the one who owns the animal). According to the study Environmental Impacts of a Pet Dog: An LCA Case Study, 2020, it appears that 90% of a pet's climate footprint comes from its diet (relative to the impact of animal waste and associated waste according to the scope of the study). For our case, we initially considered feed and veterinary services, which represent only a few kilos of CO‚ÇÇ whereas feed is responsible for hundreds of kilos for some animals. > We consider that an animal belongs to a household. In the same way as an object shared within the household, the footprint of an animal is amortized as well.

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.question: How many pets live with you in your home?
divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.description:
Dog or cat, it's time to take into account our faithful companions.

> ü¶¥ The impact of your pet is largely related to its bowl!

Figures and tables from FEDIAF, Nutritional Guidelines For a cat, we use the formula: (cat weight)^0.67 * 100 kcal for an average active animal. Here, we consider a cat of 4kg, moderately active, which gives the figures visible in the tables below. ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/229522212-30dde3ac-0c96-42f4-925a-78f122185b64.png) ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/228851632-28ad3746-7fd2-4b80-8923-a76f75dc8012.png)

divers . autres produits.description: This sub-item captures the footprint of new product purchases, linked to a person's expenditure and standard of living, via a macro-economic approach. As with the method used for societal services, we use the results of the SDES work to reconstitute the carbon footprint of purchases not captured "elsewhere" in the test for an average French person. Despite significant limitations (to be discussed shortly), this question is relevant for a number of reasons: - To broaden the scope of consumption covered by Nos Gestes Climat: here, we take into account expenses that are not captured in the rest of the test, such as **decoration, plants, etc.** such as **decoration, plants, gardening, kitchen equipment, household linen, materials for creative hobbies, DIY.** These purchases are often used over the long term and should therefore be amortized according to the type of product, but in this approach we consider that the footprint of purchases is equivalent from year to year and that depreciation is not necessary. - Enable us to group our purchases of new products into a single question and avoid focusing on "small items" with too many questions: how many vases? How many books? How many bath mats? How many cutlery sets? etc. - Raising awareness of new product purchases. In Nos Gestes Climat, the footprint of second-hand products is attributed to the original purchaser of the item. Thus, the footprint of a second-hand product is currently considered to be zero (which is clearly stated in the question). We have therefore considered in this question a breakdown of the following items whose carbon content has been assigned among all economic branches / sub-branches: - Horticulture (plants, accessories, delivery) - Glassware, tableware, kitchen utensils - Leather goods, accessories (lighters, umbrellas, sunglasses, etc.), baby equipment - Carpets and other coverings, installation and repair - Home and garden tools - Repair services for computers and personal and household goods - Products for routine home maintenance and repairs - Other manufactured products such as games, toys, sports equipment, musical instruments, jewelry and watches > For example, the "Horticulture" item comprises the "Plant reproduction" sub-branch, representing 2% of the "Agriculture and horticulture products" branch in terms of sales "the "Wholesale of flowers and plants" sub-branch, which accounts for 0.2% of the "Wholesale trade, excluding automobiles and motorcycles per inhabitant" branch, and finally the "Retail trade of flowers, plants, seeds, fertilizers, pets and pet food in specialized stores", representing 1.5% of the "Retail trade, excluding automobiles and motorcycles per capita" branch However, **the footprint captured in this question should be taken with a grain of salt**. Indeed, the macro-economic approach has several limitations, as outlined in our technical guide on societal services, in particular due to the precision of the initial data. The calculation is also based on a single figure, identical for all citizens. Nevertheless, this question proposes a modularization of the footprint via a multi-stake nivy question: Nevertheless, this method of calculation is preferred here to monetary ratios, which have an uncertainty of 80%. The emission factors in the carbon base are not up to date with today's inflation levels, and those averaged for this question are very heterogeneous (we aggregate the factor associated with publishing (books), but also that associated with plastics or metals). To conclude on this subject, and this is undoubtedly the biggest obstacle to the use of monetary ratios, the carbon intensity of a euro spent on a purchase is not at all representative of the product's real footprint. For example, it's not at all obvious that a more expensive book has a bigger footprint. Similarly, a set of linen sheets could very well have a footprint 5 times smaller than a set of cotton sheets lower than a set made from cotton (flax requires very few resources to grow), yet the latter is likely to cost up to 10 times as much.

divers . autres produits . facteur corre.description: This factor is used to modulate the footprint of new product purchases according to INSEE household expenditure statistics by decile.

divers . autres produits . niveau de d√©.question: The test doesn't yet capture all your consumption, so how would you estimate your level of spending on new products (home decoration, DIY, games, hobbies, tools, etc.)?
divers . autres produits . niveau de d√©.description:
To keep the interface simple, we propose an estimate, via your expenses, of the footprint of consumer goods
that you don't think you've included in the previous questions.

It concerns: **games, decoration, kitchen equipment, household linen, materials for hobbies and crafts, plants, etc.**

> üí° The orders of magnitude in ‚Ç¨ proposed here are based on INSEE household expenditure statistics. The average French person spends ‚Ç¨80/month on these items.

divers . num√©rique.description:
Digital has been at the heart of environmental news since 2019.

Yet its footprint isn't necessarily what we think it is: for example, the multiple devices in our homes are surprisingly large.

divers . num√©rique . internet . dur√©e.question: How many hours a day do you spend on the Internet outside the office (sending e-mails, surfing the Web, streaming video, etc.)?
divers . num√©rique . internet . dur√©e.description: Just make a rough estimate of your personal hours of use (evenings, weekends), because what you do at work is included in your company's or organization's accounts.

divers . num√©rique . pr√©servation.description:
To avoid asking you to give the precise age of all the electronic devices you own, we use an average age grid for each device, which is adjusted according to your efforts to preserve it or not
for each device, which is adjusted according to your efforts to preserve it or not.

It's up to you to judge your efforts to make them last as long as possible

> Answering "None, I often buy new" is the most impactful answer because it means that you are replacing your appliances early even before they are out of use.

> ‚ú®Ô∏è For simplicity's sake, only include recent devices: a TV that is more than 10 years old has already been well amortized.

> We will soon improve the model to take into account reconditioned devices. 
> For the moment, we advise you to add them here even the benefit of this purchase compared to the new one will not be visible in the calculation.

divers . produits consommables.description:
The aim here is to remove consumables, which are not amortized, from the "expenses" question,
in the same way as "long-term" purchases such as a musical instrument. 
The second challenge is to quantify the climate footprint of hygiene and cleaning products using a "consumption" approach
"emission factors already exist for these products.
On the other hand, the difficulty lies in the question put to the user: who is in a position to answer easily
about their consumption in terms of weight, volume or ‚Ç¨? The aim here is to facilitate the answer by defining different levels of consumption
based on quantity consumed (EFs are defined in kgCO2e/kg of product).

divers . produits consommables . emprein.titre: Footprint of consumables over a month

divers . produits consommables . consomm.question: How would you estimate your monthly consumption of hygiene products (soap, make-up...) and cleaning products (laundry, household products...)?
divers . produits consommables . consomm.description:
This question enables us to evaluate *simply* the climate footprint of your consumption of personal care products 
(perfumes, shower gels, shampoos, deodorants, toothpastes, make-up, skincare creams, sun creams...) and cleaning products 
(laundry detergents, dishwasher detergents, household products, etc.) based on 3 consumption levels.

divers . tabac.description: Tobacco is responsible for a major impact on the climate. But of course, that's not the only problem it's responsible for! According to WHO: > "Every year, the tobacco industry is responsible for more than 8 million deaths, the destruction of 600 million trees, 200,000 hectares of land, the loss of 22 billion tons of water and the emission of 84 million tons of CO2."

divers . tabac . consommation par semain.question: How much do you smoke each week?
divers . tabac . consommation par semain.description:
üí° Enter your weekly cigarette consumption here. A pack is considered to contain 20 cigarettes.
If you smoke rolls, remember to adapt your calculation.

Note that the impact of tobacco isn't just carbon: it's also responsible for deforestation, and the significant use of water and farmland!

> For the moment, we're only considering conventional cigarettes.
> Electronic cigarettes are not yet included in our calculations, due to lack of data!

divers . textile.description:
Tell us what you put in your shopping bags this year, or in a

> If you buy a sweater every 2 years, round to `1`. If you buy a sweater
> every 3 years, round to `0`.

Enter only new products. We voluntarily exclude items bought in thrift stores, recovered from friends and family, and second hand in general.

> Did you know? 

> According to a study commissioned by moving company Movinga in 2018, the French don't wear 68% (!) of their wardrobe. That's more than two-thirds of the contents of our wardrobes that never get out.

> Before buying a new item: what if you did a bit of sorting?

> This question covers all the energy sources you use to power your heaters, water heaters, hobs, etc.

Some homes use electricity only, others are heated entirely by gas, and more rarely by wood or oil.
In still other situations, a home may be heated mainly by electric heaters or a heat pump,
but with wood as a back-up, for example. Finally, you can also take into account your gas consumption for your van or motor home. 

Tick all the modes you use.

> Your condominium may not provide you with the consumption in kWh of your home, when the boiler is centralized. However, it must provide you with the amount in ‚Ç¨, which you can enter below to estimate your kWh.

logement . chauffage . gaz . biogaz.question: Have you subscribed to a gas contract that includes biogas (or biomethane)?
logement . chauffage . gaz . biogaz.description:
Biogas, or biomethane, is a gas produced from organic waste (household waste, manure, lawn waste, crops, etc.), unlike fossil gas, misleadingly called "natural" gas, which is extracted like oil from the Norwegian or Russian subsoil.

For some years now, it has been possible to subscribe to a contract that guarantees the injection into the French gas network of the same quantity of biomethane as your own consumption. The gas you consume in your home will in any case be a mixture mainly made up of the methane molecule (CH‚ÇÑ), but for every kWh of gas consumed, 1 kWh of biomethane will have been injected "on your behalf".

> Unlike gas, electricity *can't be stored*, which is why we don't offer a "green electricity" option in the simulator.

Please note that there are offers with only 10% or 20% biomethane. If this is the case, answer "no".

logement . chauffage . gaz . avertisseme.description:
You will find that choosing biogas greatly reduces the climate footprint
of the gas you consume, but note that current production is unable to
scale up: the overall reduction of all gas consumption remains
essential, whether you consume biogas or fossil gas.

logement . chauffage . biogaz . facteur.description: Biogas: Biomethane - Injected into networks - Medium mix

logement . chauffage . biogaz . part.question: How much biogas is guaranteed by your gas contract?
logement . chauffage . biogaz . part.description:
There are few gas sellers offering 100% biogas contracts, but there are some (in September 2022). 
On the other hand, France's leading gas retailer offers its customers a biogas option with an adjustable proportion at an additional cost (which is significant but does not double the bill). Don't hesitate to talk to an advisor.

Here we're considering a 13kg capacity, the most widespread model and generally used for cooking gas.

If you wish to answer in kilograms, because the size of the bottle doesn't correspond to your needs, don't hesitate to use the conversion help.

logement.description:
We can see our housing as a passive building that would not impact the
climate... we would be wrong!

The most important emission item for housing in France is heating the
air in which we live. The footprint will not be the same at all
depending on the heating technology.

But that's not all: construction, maintenance, hot water heating,
electricity, so many items that depend above all on a single parameter:
the number of m¬≤.

logement . habitants.titre: Number of people in the dwelling
logement . habitants.question: How many people live in your home?
logement . habitants.description:
We need to know how many people share your home and all the
consumption it entails (construction, heating, etc.).

> If you live alone, answer `1`.

> If you live with your spouse and a child, answer `3`.

> If you are separated with a child who alternates between your home and
> another, you can enter `1.5`.
logement . habitants.avertissement:
The number of inhabitants cannot be zero or less than 1. You are the first inhabitant of your home.

As the footprint of the home and other items such as household appliances are divided by the number of inhabitants, it must be greater than 1.

We therefore do not take into account empty homes that you own, or rented accommodation in which neither you nor anyone else lives.

logement . surface.question: What is the surface area of your home?
logement . surface.avertissement: The surface area of your home cannot be zero.

logement . appartement.question: Is your home a flat?
logement . appartement.description:
As opposed to a single-family home.

The increase in apartment housing can make us forget that the house remains the majority dwelling for French households in 2018.

This information influences not only the construction footprint, but also the possibilities for insulation work, for example.

> If you live in an unusual type of dwelling, such as a camper van / truck / barge, no problem: choose "apartment" and enter the m¬≤ of what constitutes your dwelling.

logement . notif amortissement.description:
If your home is less than **50 years old**, we give you one fiftieth of the footprint of its construction. **Otherwise, zero: the home has been depreciated**
You won't be asked any questions about the characteristics of your home, since the annual footprint of its construction is considered to be zero.

logement . piscine.description: The number of private pools **buried** in French gardens has accelerated in recent years. There are now over 3 million of them. This equipment is far from anecdotal, and contributes significantly to France's climate footprint. It's the construction, maintenance, purchase of various equipment (safety, water management, sanitary chemicals) and heating that have the biggest impact on the climate.

logement . piscine . pr√©sent.question: Do you have a private in-ground swimming pool ?
logement . piscine . pr√©sent.description: We're talking here about private **in-ground** pools, not above-ground pools, which have a much smaller carbon footprint. However, this option will be available soon!

logement . piscine . empreinte.description: This model for calculating the carbon footprint of a swimming pool comes from Futur.eco, taken from the publicodes model with its default values. It's the only open model of an individual pool's carbon footprint published to date. In this first version, we do not specifically take into account the use of the filter pump or heating, whose footprint is implicitly calculated as part of the home's energy consumption. At a later stage, it might be useful to separate the 2 consumptions so as to propose more personalized actions. Note that the water consumption aspect is not covered here as a matter of principle (our calculations focus on carbon emissions), but it is obviously essential to pay attention to it.

logement . vacances . r√©sidence seconda.description: To calculate the seasonal factors, which depend on both the location of the second home and the season in which it is visited, we have used the degree-hour data available for each climate zone, which can be found in this table. These degree hours can be found in the appendix to the Order of 8 October 2021 modifying the calculation method and the methods for establishing the energy performance diagnosis, available here. In France, there are three climate zones: H1, the coldest zone, the north-eastern half of France. H2, a temperate zone in the west and south-west. H3, the hottest zone, the south-east of France and French overseas departments and territories. ![Climate zones France](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/RT_2005_zone_climatique-2.svg/1176px-RT_2005_zone_climatique-2.svg.png) For our calculations, we have opted for the following assumptions: - Homes located on the north-west coast, in the countryside or in towns, correspond to the average for zones H1 and H2 < 800 m√®tres d'altitude - Les logements situ√©s sur le littoral m√©diterran√©en correspondent √† la zone H3 < 400 m√®tres d'altitude - Les logements situ√©s en montagne correspondent aux zones H1 et H2 > 800 metres above sea level We have related this to the average daily degree-hours over the year, to establish the multiplication factors for the average heating degree-hours for one day, whatever the location. multiplication factors by climate zone and period](https://github.com/incubateur-ademe/nosgestesclimat/assets/55186402/c328fa42-bae6-4391-becf-a31cbaf32201)

services marchands.description: Market services are only part of the societal services whose calculation is based on the estimation of the French national footprint by the Ministry of Ecology.

services publics.description: Utilities are only part of the societal services whose calculation is based on the estimate of the French national footprint by the Ministry of Ecology.

services soci√©taux.description:
This item includes the footprint of French public services, and market services that can be considered essential to everyone's life, divided by the country's population.  

The first category "public services" includes for example the footprint of French hospitals, or justice. We consider that this footprint should be equally distributed for all citizens, because these are "republican" jobs that only democracy can make evolve, not directly by individual consumption choices 

The second category "market services" includes the telecommunications network (fiber, telephone, etc.), but also insurance and the post office. These are relatively universal services for which we do not yet have the details that would allow us to distribute the footprint according to the consumption choices of citizens.

<RavijenChartSocietaux/>

services soci√©taux . question rh√©toriq.question: We allocate the footprint of public (education, health...) and commercial (telecom, insurance...) services to each citizen equally.
services soci√©taux . question rh√©toriq.description: This category does not depend on your answers. The associated footprint is calculated via a macro-economic approach at the national level. Learn more about this category.

transport . avion.description: ![](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1525624286412-4099c83c1bc8?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=300&q=80) The footprint of the plane is substantial. It is not necessarily more polluting *per kilometer* than a car that only moves one person, but the distance and especially the distance covered in one hour (commonly called speed), allows to change continent for a weekend. Let's also keep in mind that the average French person does not fly or does not fly much. Most of the aviation footprint is therefore concentrated on 10% or less of the French population. > For the definition of flight ranges, from short-haul to long-haul, we use this discussion from the Base Carbone forum.

We've chosen to offer you a way of counting the impact of your air travel over several years. The footprint on the climate is such that it's important to take this into account.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. Our objective is to estimate the footprint of a passenger on passenger ferries such as those linking mainland France to Corsica and England. The ferry is often proposed as a serious alternative to the plane in terms of carbon footprint, but there was no estimate of its climate footprint per kilometre (neither ADEME in France, nor internationally, nor in the scientific literature) that takes into account not an average passenger, but the diversity of options for a ticket: - passenger in car or not - passengers in cabins, seats or on the ground - the ship's leisure facilities: restaurant, bar, swimming pool, large corridors, etc. - freight loaded in trucks - % full on the boat - speed - etc We know how much greenhouse gas (GHG) a given ferry emits: all we have to do is multiply its fuel consumption by the CO2e emission factor(s) of the fuel used. But the difficulty then lies in attributing a share of these GHGs to the passenger on foot, to the passenger alone in his or her car enjoying a VIP lounge, to the transport of goods, and so on. The calculation principle adopted here is simple: we allocate a footprint according to the volume that the ticket purchased by the passenger and the consumption choices made on board occupy on the boat. Here is the method note (~20 pages) which explains the problem we want to solve and the possibilities for making the calculation, but which remains theoretical. Then, in concrete terms, you can take an interactive and complete look at the calculation of the dynamic emission factor just below ‚¨áÔ∏è. Finally, don't hesitate to make suggestions for modifying the model, either via a pull request on github or via a simple comment on this ticket. In practice, we're doing this on the Mega Express Four type boat simply because we have fairly detailed plans of it. The work should be done for other ships in the future. the Mega Express Four sailing on the Mediterranean](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/02_Corsica_Ferries_Mega_Express_Four_(cropped\).jpg/640px-02_Corsica_Ferries_Mega_Express_Four_\(cropped\).jpg) More information on the Mega Express Four* The calculation of the various surfaces is based on anSVG drawing on a plan of the ship's decks, which then allows us to deduce the volumes, and is therefore one of the keys to the calculation. ### Limits of the calculation A bias to be noted would be the inaccuracy of this plan of the ferry and the measurements made on it. However, it seems fairly reliable for an order of magnitude, which is our aim here. Another bias is obviously the choice of what is counted as useful surface area and what is not. For example, we have excluded the open-air decks, except for the swimming pool and outdoor bars. Obviously, the calculation is only strictly applicable to this boat, but we have chosen to extrapolate it as a typical boat because we don't have the resources to model every commercial boat. See also this ticket to read and contribute to the limits of the calculation.
futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.valeur: empreinte du bateau * part du volume

futureco-data . transport . ferry . fact.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. It assumes a cubic evolution of power as a function of speed.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . corr.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. The power required to propel a ship is the cube of its speed. The climate footprint per hour naturally follows this same function. But the ship is then going faster: it will emit more per hour for less time, so this factor corrects for.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . vite.valeur: distance aller / dur√©e du voyage . r√©elle

futureco-data . transport . ferry . dist.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. We don't yet calculate the actual distances crossed by boats. So adding a 30% factor will help us get closer. If you have access to a sourced average factor, please let us know.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . dur√.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. We consider that for a departure at 7pm on the ticket, and an arrival at 7am, for the calculation of speed the crossing did not last 12h but 11h, because there are 30 minutes before the ferry starts and then 30 minutes of disembarkation. Of course, this may vary depending on the company and the type of ticket (pedestrian or car boarding), but it's an order of magnitude. For short crossings of less than 3 hours, we deduct 10% of the time (also by convention), i.e. 20 minutes * 2 for 3 hours, for example.

transport . ferry . empreinte.description: The ferry model comes from Futur.eco. This model is explained in simplified form on the "Footprint per km and passenger" page, and is based on an in-depth study (see the complete methodological note) In order to simplify the assessment of the user's footprint, we propose an estimate based on travel time (in hours). We then set the other calculation parameters as such: - Cabin travel - One car on board - 2 people share cabin, car - Ferry model considered (layout, average speed): Mega Express Four
transport . ferry . empreinte.valeur: (heures * 33 km/h) * futureco-data . transport . ferry . empreinte par km volume

transport . ferry . usager.question: Do you take the ferry?
transport . ferry . usager.description:
Answer yes if you're taking the ferry to neighboring islands or continents (Corsica, UK, Maghreb...).

If you take cruises (long voyages where you live on the boat), also answer yes: initially, we count ferry and cruise times in the same way.

If you don't take the ferry every year, but intend to continue taking it, answer "yes" and roughly estimate the number of hours per year.

For example, for a 9h crossing (one night) every 3 years, answer `3`.

transport . ferry . heures.question: How many hours a year do you travel by ferry or cruise?
transport . ferry . heures.description:
For the moment, we do not take into account the options that can increase or decrease the footprint of a ferry crossing: 
  - car on board
  - filling the cabin or reserving a seat
  - use of services on board (restaurant, stores)
  - and of course the speed of the boat (the faster a boat is, the more it consumes).

The calculation is made for a typical crossing.

transport . mobilit√© douce.question: What are your "efficient" modes of transport?
transport . mobilit√© douce.description:
These modes of transport are often referred to as "soft" modes. This adjective does little to highlight their incredible efficiency.

With equipment weighing less than 20 kg (30 kg for cargo bikes), you can easily transport the weight of one, or even two or three people (one bike with two children on board) over short, sometimes medium, more rarely long distances. And the shopping too!

> üí° The "Small electric vehicle" category includes electric scooters, but also giropods, monowheels, hoverboards...

> Tip: Think of your cargo bike as an EV if it electrically powered, as a classic bike if it's not.

transport . mobilit√© douce . notif marc.description:
**You have ticked walking or cycling ?
Congratulations! üëè

Cycling is a super sober mode of transport: you use 15 kilos of material to move a ~70 kilo body.
As for your shoes, they're an ultra-lightweight vehicle!

üí° Note that the footprint of walking and the one for **using** the classic bicycle (not manufacturing) is considered zero.

transport.description:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Correspondances_Pey_Berland_ao√ªt_2016.jpg/640px-Correspondances_Pey_Berland_ao√ªt_2016.jpg)

Unsurprisingly, transport, and above all oil-based transport, accounts for a very large part of our footprint.

This category covers everything to do with getting around. We've also included uses that could be considered *leisure*, relating to vacations, such as caravans and motorhomes

transport . vacances.question: What do you own for your weekends and holidays (apart from your main vehicle)?
transport . vacances.description:
Here you can select what you need for your holidays. The "converted van" category includes converted vans and lorries. 

If you have already entered the kilometres travelled in a converted van previously, indicating "light commercial vehicle" as the main vehicle used for travel, then you can tick "none" here.

üí° If you don't own a motorhome, caravan or converted van, or if you hire them out, you can click on "none" just below this question, then "Next". Rental is not yet available in our model**.

transport . voiture.description:
![](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1572312284222-ecf6d70f1907?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=400&q=80)

Today's cars in France are mainly combustion-powered (petrol, diesel), although electric vehicles are making slow progress.

However, whether electric or combustion-powered, the car remains a highly inefficient means of transport:
**On average, it's enough to move an 80kg human being in a 1200kg metal box**.

It's a bit like making lunch for 10 and then throwing away 90% of the food, or deciding to heat the whole block rather than the inside of each of the 10 houses.

Finally, it's important to take into account both the use (the kilometers traveled) and the construction of this vehicle made of over a ton of various materials.

transport . voiture . km.question: How far do you travel per year by car?
transport . voiture . km.description:
Only count kilometers for personal travel (shopping, leisure, family, etc.) and for commuting to your usual place of work.

For example, if you're on a business assignment in another department or another country, this is included in your company's accounts: don't count it here.

transport . voiture . utilisateur r√©gul.question: Do you mostly use the same car to get around?
transport . voiture . utilisateur r√©gul.description:
As opposed to the exclusive use of rental cars shared with other people the rest of the time, or the occasional use of a friend's or family car.

You don't own a car, but you still put in the miles.

Answer yes if you use the same vehicle most of the time, either as a passenger or as a driver. 

This could be the case if the vehicle belongs to a family member or close friend. Or if you systematically rent the same type of vehicle, as in the case of a subscription to a car-sharing service.

transport . voiture . notif utilsateur i.description: You drive different vehicles, so we've given you the characteristics of an "average" car.

transport . voiture . empreinte utilisat.valeur: (((construction / dur√©e de vie) * facteur location) + usage) / voyageurs

transport . voiture . voyageurs.titre: Average number of passengers in the car
transport . voiture . voyageurs.question: What is the average number of passengers in the car?
transport . voiture . voyageurs.description:
A car consumes roughly the same amount of fuel whether it has 1, 2 or 5 passengers on board. So travelling with several people means potentially dividing your individual footprint by 5!

ü§î But this is not an easy question: it's likely that in the course of a year you'll have gone on vacation with 3 people, taken the car every day on your own, and so on.

Try to estimate a rough average: if every day you take the car by yourself, put 1 or 1.2.
If you only drive with family or friends, put 3 or 4.

> In a future development of the simulator, we'll be able to separate the questions by type of journey: vacation, home-work, daily with a customizable number of travellers.

Of course, if you're driving yourself or taking a cab, the driver doesn't count, as he's there to help you make your journey.
transport . voiture . voyageurs.avertissement: The number of passengers cannot be zero. At the wheel of your car, you are the first passenger.

transport . voiture . thermique . emprei.description:
The footprints are available in some detail on [the carbon
base](https://bilans-ges.ademe.fr/fr/basecarbone/donnees-consulter/liste-element?recherche=diesel),
here for example for "diesel". Same for "gasoline". To find them easily,
filter by unit "kgCO2e/liter" and by geography "continental France".

Note that for diesel, the FE chosen is the average between B7 diesel and
B10 diesel.

transport . voiture . thermique . carbur.question: What type of fuel does your car use?
transport . voiture . thermique . carbur.description: To help you understand the different types of fuel, this educational article is very useful. This article from the French Ministry of Ecology explains in greater detail the fuels legal in France. > Please note that while the type of fuel varies significantly in terms of climate footprint per liter, consumption in liters per 100km also varies. Be sure to enter a consumption per liter based on your actual average.

transport . voiture . notif carburant.description:
Your vehicle runs on biofuel: in addition to the carbon footprint of biofuels, we need to be aware that they also have a footprint on the soil: this soil could be used to grow cereals to feed us or serve as a biodiversity refuge.
This is what is known as "land use change" here, for the purposes of biofuel production. Unfortunately, the impact on the climate of this change of use is difficult to quantify and particularly uncertain.

We have chosen to include this option in the test, but it should be noted that this result **is not representative of the likely environmental consequences associated with the use of biofuels**

transport . voiture . construction.description:
![](https://i.imgur.com/uIlZcEjl.jpg)

A car is a big, big object, often weighing over a ton and a half. As a result, its construction has a significant footprint.

In particular, the construction of an electric car in the same range as a combustion engine emits more greenhouse gases. This is mainly due to the battery and its considerable weight.

Despite this, in France, over the life of the car and therefore the number of kilometers covered, the choice of an electric car is clearly better for the climate.

Better, but far from poor! In 2020, it's not just a question of comparing technical solutions, it's a question of evaluating purchases in relation to climate objectives.

transport . voiture . v√©hicule r√©cent.question: Is your vehicle less than 10 years old?
transport . voiture . v√©hicule r√©cent.description:
To calculate the footprint of the car's construction, which should not be neglected, we use the car's age.

Be sure to answer by considering *the age of the car*, not the number of years it has been in your possession: chances are you bought it second-hand.

> If two of you use two cars, you can simply allocate one to each of you.
> If you own several cars that you use only yourself, ~~at least sell the second one~~ this case is not yet foreseen.

transport . voiture . amortissement.description: There were lively discussions about the car's depreciation. Previously, in order to discourage the purchase of new cars, a non-linear depreciation had been imagined, strongly decreasing over time, over 10 years. This non-linear depreciation had the merit of discouraging the purchase, and of making it clear to the user that a large part of the vehicle's footprint is linked to its production, and therefore to the new purchase. But this non-linear depreciation was not easy for users to understand, and missed its educational objective. In addition, it created a double discourse in Nos Gestes Climat, because in the actions proposed to car owners, we propose the purchase of an electric vehicle, which is strongly penalized if purchased new in the individual carbon footprint. Finally, there was one exception in the Nos Gestes Climat simulator: all other assets are depreciated on a straight-line basis (the construction footprint is divided by the asset's lifespan). We therefore chose to revert to straight-line depreciation over the life of the car, i.e. 19 years according to this source.
